alert.note: Alert for Cooper (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 7:30AM CDT until June 01 at 1:39PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Cooper and Pettis. In west central Missouri, Henry and Johnson MO. * WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 AM CDT, the transportation department reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sedalia, Clinton, Windsor, Smithton, Leeton, Green Ridge, Calhoun, Otterville, Prairie Home and Post Oak. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
